Module kivakit.core.resource
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.resource.compression.archive

Class ZipArchive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.resource.compression.archive.ZipArchive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteSized, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Iterable<ZipEntry>
    public final class ZipArchive
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<ZipEntry>, java.lang.AutoCloseable, ByteSized
    A wrapper around the JDK zip filesystem that makes it easier to use. A ZipArchive can be created with open(File, ProgressReporter, Mode), which returns the open zip archive or null if the operation fails. Adds the ability to save and load objects into zip entries using a SerializationSession. A zip archive contains entries wrapped by ZipEntry and a ZipArchive is Iterable to make it easy to enumerate zip entries: 
     var archive = new ZipArchive("test.zip");
 for (var entry : archive)
 {
     System.out.println(entry);
 }

    Adding Files

    Files can be added to the archive with add(List). To do this, the zip file must be opened in ZipArchive.Mode.WRITE.

    Saving

    • save(String, Resource) - Saves the given resources into the named zip entry
    • save(SerializationSession, String, VersionedObject) - Writes the object to the given entry
    • saveEntry(String, Callback) - Saves to the named entry calling the callback to do the work

    Loading

    • load(SerializationSession, String) - Loads the object from the named entry using the given serializer
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    ZipEntry, ProgressReporter, SerializationSession, Resource

        public ZipEntry entry​(java.lang.String pathname)
        If the archive resource is a file, uses ZipFile to access the zip entry directly. Otherwise, resorts to scanning the entire input stream for the entry.
        Returns:
        The entry, if any, for the given name
